messages.content:
Hi Matic team, we started work on Biconomy mexa-sdk and receive the error when trying to interact with MTX token on 0x4DfAe612aaCB5b448C12A591cD0879bFa2e51d62 address on Mumbai network. I trying to call withdrawal methods for transfer funds to Ether network and got ->  Returned error: gas required exceeds allowance (20000000) or always failing transaction" from Biconomy mexa-sdk library! 
Last my suggestion that I use not correct ABI for this contract. But seems this problem regarding to mexa-sdk library! Any suggestions on how I can fix it?

> Hi Matic team, we started work on Biconomy mexa-sdk and receive the error when trying to interact with MTX token on 0x4DfAe612aaCB5b448C12A591cD0879bFa2e51d62 address on Mumbai network. I trying to call withdrawal methods for transfer funds to Ether network and got ->  Returned error: gas required exceeds allowance (20000000) or always failing transaction" from Biconomy mexa-sdk library! 
> Last my suggestion that I use not correct ABI for this contract. But seems this problem regarding to mexa-sdk library! Any suggestions on how I can fix it?
@Maximka  this error comes when transaction would fail if biconomy relays that transaction.
So biconomy returns this error instead of sending the transaction. 

From what I understand you are calling withdraw method on Matic contracts..  and I don't think that contract has native meta transaction enabled.
Someone from Matic can comment on this.

Thanks, @Sachin | Biconomy for your answer! But @Anurag propose to use this tool for doing meta-transactions and I expected that I can use this functionality for withdrawing funds from the Matic network! For us very important this functionality to allow users to withdraw funds without paying the fee! I mean we want to pay a fee instead of our customers!
@Maximka currently all transactions on Matic network can be routed via Biconomy for meta-transactions
The Withdraw transaction is comprised of 2 steps - tx on Matic, followed by tx on Ethereum
I guess you are referring to the Ethereum tx - work on enabling that for meta-transaction is still being reviewed internally. We will get back on this.
Thanks for helping @Anurag ! I will follow for your updates.
GG @Maximka, you just advanced to level 1!
@Maximka yes we are still reviewing it

Hello Matic team! 
I recently discovered what I assume an unexpected behavior, after I tried working with Biconomy in connection to the newly introduced Proof-of-Work mechanism in the Matic.
I continue my attempts to implement meta transactions with the Matic, in order to charge transaction fees not to the user wallets, but to the wallets that belong to the app. After integration with Biconomy, as in illustrated in my code below, I added interaction with WETH Matic token contract to use approving() and allowance() functionalities:

After interaction with the smart contract I expect to receive 100, but for yet unknown for me reasons,  I always receive 0.
After looking into the response details of the approve() function, I found that the sender is not userWallet, but some wallet belonging to the Biconomy platform. Let's call it biconomyWallet. And, if to call allowance() function with (biconomyWallet, quizAddress) parameters, the expected 100 is received. That looks a bit off the logical path, as biconomyWallet does not contain WETH tokens and thus should not be able to give an allowance to pay.  
Then I went investigating Biconomy tutorial and I would say there is another interesting details - they strongly recommended removing msg.sender and msg.value, and switch them to their internal functionality:

Source ->
This section explains how you can enable native meta transactions in your smart contract. It means we have to get rid of msg.sender and msg.value properties in our code.
Link ->
https://docs.biconomy.io/tutorials/native-meta-transactions/enable-native-meta-transactions/smart-contract

Looking further into the Matic documentation, I found link to the Proof-fo-Stake contracts:

source ->
https://github.com/maticnetwork/pos-portal/tree/v1.0.0/contracts/child/ChildToken

Finally, I discovered, according to my understanding, that Matic integrates only deposit() and withdraw() functions with Biconomy. Does it mean that Biconomy woud never work with ERC-20 functionalities like approve(), allowance(), transfer()? Do you have plans to implement Biconomy functionalities for the Proof-fo-Stake? contracts?

Our team highly appreciate your support. We're eager to get through all the concerns we have, and proudly make the release on Matic. I'm always glad to add more or clarify the details.

> Hi Matic team. Do you have any documents where I can check or calculate how much Matic coins I must pay for the transaction gas fee inside the Matic network?
@Maximka Hello , we've something like so , that we call matic gas station, what it does is: it can recommend you gas price, you can set before sending transaction off to matic network. We've improved it little bit, which is in deployment queue. As soon as it gets clearance, we'll deploy it, and will let you know here. You can simply send HTTP GET request to that end point & obtain json response.

hey guys, need someone to get me on track on Matic

we're thinking of leveraging Matic for Ethereum smart contract that exists as NFT pool where users can basically move in/out their ERC721s (NFTs) for some arbitrary that's done in the contract itself

in other words in order to transfer NFT to contract on Matic I have to have this NFT transferred to Matic first? this sounds too obvious for me, but just want to check if I'm on the right track

any feedback appreciated 🙏
@Anurag

@team Dear Matic Team: My Build-N-Earn team, Meme of the Day, is modeling out our budget and economic scenarios, including Matic Network transaction costs. Due to the bull run, the MATIC token has doubled in value, which doubles the cost of our transactions. We are concerned that over time, as the ecosystem grows, the cost to transact with MATIC will continue to rise. What is Matic team's strategy to keep the value of the MATIC token stable and help keep L2 transactions affordable?

Hey Matthew. The current txn costs are still very cheap at $0.00006 on average. 
If Matic was to get as popular as Ethereum - which does 1.15M txns in a day and our coin would go 10X from today - the daily cost of all of those txns would still be ~$690.
That being said, our tech is horizontally scalable and if txn cost starts to become an impediment, we can spawn chains horizontally and keep the txn costs low

@arjunkalsy Thank you for the reply. We are modeling significant scaling scenarios, so every penny difference in MATIC token value has a noticeable effect. Could you share more details on this horizontal scaling strategy, ex. at what point will Matic spawn additional chains; what are plans for MATIC token price stability?

Hi, super noob here. I tried swapping USDC to DAI through Curve's Polygon site. I think I scuffed it because I put too low of a gas limit. It's not letting me speed up or cancel my transaction. Is there a way for me to fix my issue?
Hello is there a admin that can help me sort out where my funds went after using the bridge tool?

If you are not comfortable posting the details of the transaction, you can open a ticket and they will reply back to you. 
https://wallet-support.matic.network/portal/en/home

messages.content: Ty
Hi, new here so not sure if I should be asking in this channel. But, I started a transfer from matic to eth and I’m stuck after checkpoint because I want to cancel the transaction and not sure how
Once the transaction has started, you cannot cancel.
What you can do is wait for the rates to decrease to confirm the transaction.
ok, thanks

Hi I'm having an issue. I deposited 5132 matic into Aave, which went through. For some reason it accidentally tried to deposit another 5000 matic into Aave which I did not have in my wallet. That transaction has now been stuck in pending for over 3 hours with no way for me to cancel it. I also can't make any other transactions, because this transaction is first in the que. Is there anyway to fix this?
nvm figured it out all good
If possible post the solution for when someone goes through it know how to solve.
Please.
I went into settings on metmask and clicked reset your account, which reset my transaction log.
Is there a way to cancel a transaction on the matic bridge? I have funds stuck and can't send or move money from matic
Transaction doesn't show in metamask, but does on the bridge
There isn't a way to cancel. If you are having trouble I suggest you open a support ticket for the team to investigate: https://wallet-support.matic.network/portal/en/home
